New Records: Travis Head scored 80 off 25 balls, hitting five sixes and 12 fours.
Australia set the highest T20I powerplay total of 113 for one.
Scotland's total of 154 for nine was chased down by Australia within 10 overs.
Key Match Events: Travis Head was dismissed by Mark Watt after a scintillating 25-ball innings.
Josh Inglis contributed with an unbeaten 27 to help Australia secure a seven-wicket victory.
Sean Abbott was the pick of the Australia bowlers with three wickets for 39 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Mitch Marsh showed intent with a 30-run over early in the innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Travis Head narrowly missed breaking the record for the quickest century in T20I history.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the opening T20I between Scotland and Australia.
